WRITING.TITLE: b'"Unseasoned Food"'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: White american here. I think this stereotype is quite funny as I am the epitome of it.    I dont like tomato sauce on my pasta. I just eat it with salt. Honestly sometimes I dont even put salt on it.    I dont put sugar on my rice crispys or wheat flakes.   My favorite food is bread. Just bread.   I eat veggie sushi. no soy sauce or anything else. just vegetables surrounded by rice   I only drink water and milk, and occasionally some very mild lemonade.   perhaps controversial in white spaces, i do not like Ketchup and Mayo.   the only things with flavor I like are fruits like strawberries, oranges, blueberries, lemons, cherries etc.    I do like raisins but it is absolutely true that white people put them in too many things.

I used to wash my skin more frequently but it made my skin irritated and dry even with lotion, and I am clean this way so I do it this way.    peoples skin needs different things. if i'm just sitting about sewing all day my skin does not get dirty.  People are judging here for their hygiene...  perhaps we should think of our modern clothes washing practices   detergent doesn't get rid of bacteria, only dirt! we wash our undies with our outer wear!! modern people have poopy clothes. WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I live in the south east of america, and we just call cellar spiders cellar spiders. Daddy long legs (or just daddies for short) are these spider like things (if you look closely they only have one body segment) they have a small round  body with two tiny eyes and eight lengthy legs. I don't know why they are called daddies or daddy long legs lol

WRITING.TITLE: b' '

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I recently started telling my dream characters that I know I am dreaming, And at first they denied it. Had a dream last night where my friend said something weird and i was like "Ohhh im dreaming" then she started doing creepy dream shit and I told her that instead of doing that, she should shapeshift into something cool. she shifted into a few movie characters but didn\'t do a good job and I criticised her acting skills. then I woke up. WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: A tip for garb: Wear Linen. It's historically what undergarments were made out of and is really good at wicking away sweat.
